body:
@2vinodhkumar Please fix the title and the commit message to fit for the required format:
"FINERACT-XXXX: short description"

Also please squash your commits: 1 PR 1 commit only!

Also please add at least one test case (integration test) which proves this fix is working!

Seems like we have a contester for the same story :)
https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/3645
I am merging it and raise a separate fix for processing holidays.
I am closing hence someone else was already fixed it and it got merged

> I am merging it and raise a separate fix for processing holidays.

Thank you. I will take care of it. Could you please share the jira tiket number for me?

@mariiaKraievska https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/3647 I have raised the fix in this PR.

I was not sure whether you are available before the holidays or not, so that's why I decided to merge your PR and raise an another one for this.

> @mariiaKraievska For improving the test: "This test is not really testing whether only the schedule that fall on that particular date was rescheduled. You should check whether the following periods after the one that got rescheduled was not moved."
> 
> Feel free to raise an another PR for the same story. It is not crucial anymore.

Sure, I will do this. Thank you. I'm available, so if there are any other tasks that need to be done, feel free to contact me, I'll be happy to do it.

@mariiaKraievska thanks for all the contributions you've been making over the past several months - it's gladly appreciated. what is best means of contacting you as I do have some other high priority tasks that could greatly benefit the community I'd like to discuss.

> @mariiaKraievska thanks for all the contributions you've been making over the past several months - it's gladly appreciated. what is best means of contacting you as I do have some other high priority tasks that could greatly benefit the community I'd like to discuss.

To be honest, I am a member of the [Onix-Systems](https://onix-systems.com/) team, and we are deeply interested in harnessing the potential of Fineract. We want to contribute more actively to the project and involve more of our developers. Please contact my CTO, Denis Sheremetov - [denis@onix-systems.com](mailto:denis@onix-systems.com)

Hi @edcable! Thank you for noting our contribution. Fineract is a very interesting and mature product, and we are glad that we were able to put our efforts into its development. In the future, we would like to be more valuable contributors to the project and work on more complex and important tasks. If you don't mind, let's schedule a call and discuss how we could be useful to the project and the project to us. You can write me on email.

"Forking Renovate" is the sister app to Mend's [Renovate Bot](https://github.com/apps/renovate) app. The difference is that Forking Renovate operates using forks of repositories instead of as a collaborator, so needs only read-only permissions rather than read-write. It works on public (e.g. open source) repositories only.

Please see the Renovate Bot page and documentation for further details.

body: @josehernandezfintecheandomx ... please, proper PR title format.
Doesn't seem to be worked on anymore. Closing.

Hi, I'm Rajkumar Selvaraj. I resolved one minor issue in the LoanAccountdata file. 

issuse resolved in loanaccount data.

Issue - When I assign loan product to a client, I got an "NullpointerException" when the Borrowcycle is true in the loan product. The reason behind is The loanCycle number is null by default, When the borrowcycle (Terms vary based on loan cycle) is enable in the loan product, There is an "if" condition on the "LoanAccountData" which compares the loancyclenumber with 0 to see whether the loancycle number greater zero or not. We can't comapre an null with an int value in the "if" class.
![Screenshot (59)](https://github.com/apache/fineract/assets/148527647/0f999edb-bafd-44d7-84ee-5986f34e27d7)

@Rajkumar-Selvaraj please make sure you follow the convention on how to format the PR title! Is there a Jira ticket for this issue? If not please make sure to create one first and explain there in detail.

@Rajkumar-Selvaraj Please use the same message in the commit message as in the title.

Please use the same formatting  in the commit message as it was used in the PR title.

"FINERACT-XXXX: description of the changes". You might wanna use the same as the PR title.

I have reviewed the code and it is Ok for the create client maker-checker action. 

Is there a way to include in the integration test case some coverage for Loan, Savings, Transaction (disbursement, withdrawal/deposit)? 

This is because I think that this is an important feature enhancement.
@adamsaghy  I have updated the test case to fully check all rescheduled date's validity. Please review and let me know if this is good.

> @adamsaghy  I have updated the test case to fully check all rescheduled date's validity. Please review and let me know if this is good.

Please squash your commits!

1 PR, 1 commit ;)
Is it still needed @vidakovic? I did a dep upgrade beginning of Dec.
@marta-jankovics are you planning to work on this? It's conflicting and looks stale.
yes... there are a lot more upgrades... this will be the base for the release. Please leave as is. Thanks.

@mariiaKraievska Can you please leave this story until we carefully design the solution, discuss it with the community and wait for the developers response? Your solution might work, although I've commented some code parts that should be changed, but let us think first on the final solution we should go for. We should be careful here, because with this story, the usage of the batch API will be changed.
I really appriciate your contribution. If you have time, until this story is well designed, it will be a big help, if you could check
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-2013 
Thank you!
Done in FINERACT-2009
Done in FINERACT-2009
@galovics Conflicts were resolved, please review.

> I have reviewed the code and it is Ok for the create client maker-checker action.
> 
> Is there a way to include in the integration test case some coverage for Loan, Savings, Transaction (disbursement, withdrawal/deposit)?
> 
> This is because I think that this is an important feature enhancement.

Thank you for your review.
I chose CREATE_CLIENT because it is one of the most complicated cases. The request and the command is made for CREATE_CLIENT which is not maker-checker, but ACTIVATE_CLIENT, which runs hidden as a side-action, is maker-checker. So when you try to approve the maker CREATE_CLIENT command request, it should be successful, even if the main action is not 'maker'.
For your request I've added now one more test case, which is more simpler: WITHDRAWAL_SAVINGSACCOUNT. It is a real maker-checker transaction level action, on Savings Account main entity.
If 4 eye is working for both of these cases then I do not think that any more tests are required, because the concept is the same for all other entities/actions.

Hello Marta,

This change targets Transactions executed on Savings Accounts? Question is raised because I see that Test Case is for Savings. What about repayments on Loans?

Regards

> Hello Marta,
> 
> This change targets Transactions executed on Savings Accounts? Question is raised because I see that Test Case is for Savings. What about repayments on Loans?
> 
> Regards

Test case is for one workflow, but it is independent from that workflow, the thrown errors and response codes are global.
FINERACT-2034 : Fixed Handle Null Loan Cycle Counter in Loan Product Assignment for Borrow Cycle Enabled Products

body:
Bringing some side conversations back to this PR, see below

Hello James,

I managed to run RAT which identified the licenses it deems
incompatible. In my opinion, this is a false positive, here is the
license message. It allows for Redistribution and use in source and
binary forms, with or without modification.

Therefore I think we can go ahead. Let me know what you think.

Copyright (c) Felix Bhm
All rights reserved.

Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are
met:

Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice,
this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.

Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright
notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the
documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution.

THIS IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND
ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE
IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR
CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL,
EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO,
PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR
PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF
LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING
NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS,
EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.

If this is the only rat error, then yes

I think this is a BSD clause 2 and therefore a Category A license 

https://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-a

Github should tell you what license it is.  

Sent from Gmail Mobile

> Please don't merge this one before we've created release 1.9.0. Let's target 1.10.0. Jira tickets updated.

@vidakovic now that 1.9 is out, can we resume this? This PR is purely documentation related and does not contain any fineract code and therefore should be safe to merge without breaking anything.

> Please don't merge this one before we've created release 1.9.0. Let's target 1.10.0. Jira tickets updated.

@vidakovic now that 1.9 is out, can we resume this? This PR is purely documentation related and does not contain any fineract code and therefore should be safe to merge without breaking anything.
Thanks @adamsaghy , Will do so
@adamsaghy  It's Done. Kindly review. Thanks

@adamsaghy , Yes the number of previous passwords is configurable but we have a hardcoded values to act like a default.When the configuration is disabled. On assumption a user won't hit. So the change password on enable/disable will keep checking but since we have a default with a high cap. This won't catch him
@josehernandezfintecheandomx Please dont forget to squash your commits! ;)

> @adamsaghy , Yes the number of previous passwords is configurable but we have a hardcoded values to act like a default.When the configuration is disabled. On assumption a user won't hit. So the change password on enable/disable will keep checking but since we have a default with a high cap. This won't catch him

I dont like the hardcoded value. If the functionality is disabled, then there should be **no** any check for previous passwords.
The new configuration should be **turned on by default** and you might wanna set it for a higher number if you think 3 is not reasonable.

If the reuse is disabled, we shall not throw an error if the user wanna update its password.

> LGTM But please dont forget to cover with test! Also the PR title and commit message does not fit for the requirements: FINERACT-XXXX:

@adamsaghy Done! The PR has been updated according the latest comments. Thanks!
@adamsaghy  Thanks. I will Update as required.

body: Made changes to Loan Repayment schedule transaction processors for adding N+1 installments, for loan reschedule cases.
Superseded by #3694.

hi @GoyalRocks007 , I'm not really convinced this change is needed. I see your path has a whitespace in it and that's causing the problem. I'm afraid there are other problems lying around that'll be triggered as soon as you try to use whitespace in paths.

I'd suggest please put your project into a path without whitespaces.
@HarimbolaSantatra please rebase your PR to the latest develop, it's gonna fix the build issues.

Hello @galovics , I understand. Actually my username has a space in it and it will require changes at system level. However, I faced this issue while building the project due to the same and I thought it will be good if the project is able to handle it....

@GoyalRocks007 I understand that but as I said before, I think there are many more places where a space in a path name will simply crash the application, even during runtime, so just changing the swagger generation path is not a full-fledged fix for this problem.

@galovics as of now, I have faced the problem in this particular piece of code only. It also makes sense that fixing a problem in just one part of code serves no purpose. However, I see 2 paths of action from here:
1) I will keep posting changes if I face problems in future
2) I close this PR
Will do, whatever you think is the best..
Login from web-app: ![image](https://github.com/apache/fineract/assets/5830589/3e343a47-cae0-43c8-bf00-e659355b0a58)

> Hi @Onyx2406, can you pls elaborate a bit more how this is fixing something?
> 
> The original implementation is also using a preparedstatement under the hood, only Sonar doesn't detect that, hence the // NOSONAR comment, but it's perfectly safe from SQL injection.
> 
> Let me know.


@galovics 
Thank you for your insights and feedback on the PR. After considering your comments, I agree that the original implementation using jdbcTemplate.queryForRowSet, internally uses a PreparedStatement, is sufficient for our needs and is safe from SQL injection concerns. Given this, I am closing this PR.
@bharathc27 When the `Transfer Interest To Savings` job running and one of the savings account throw `InsufficientAccountBalanceException`, should the whole job stop and marked as FAILED?

body: Superseded by #3733.
I have solved 2 issues and unfortunately pulled in the same PR. I will dissect and pull in different PRs
Superseded by #3742.
Hi @adamsaghy , should I take any steps to merge this into the develop branch?

hi @galovics ,

Regarding Point No. 2 above, It was kept in that format to be able to run a highly concurrent user requests all working across different account numbers at a time (Say 1000 concurrent requests with each request working on different account number at a time). The use CSV config file helps achieving the unique account numbers to be used across different threads.  This can be simplified to just create and use account numbers from within the JMeter suite for a relatively lower concurrent user requests.

Point 3.  The transactions can be performed repetitively. In its current format it expects to clear the data and re-run. By simplifying the format of usage in Point 2, this behavior will change.

Point 4. By default both read and write points to same IP and it works against the single instance Fineract without Read/Write seperation. I have added the provision to be able to work with a Read/Write seperated setup, in which case, user can specify a different IP for those two instances.

With further simplified version, we can change behavior to overcome the observations you mentioned in 2 and 3 above.
@hero78 Please rebase and squash your commits!
